common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2 incompatibility
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a dependency on AVX2 instructions, not supported by some older CPUs. The Pieces team acknowledged the problem, released a fix in version 11.1.2, and users confirmed the resolution.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User is encountering an issue with the latest version of PiecesOS, unable to launch it.
* Developer acknowledges the issue and confirms it's related to AVX2 incompatibility on the user's CPU.
* User provides CPU information (Intel Core i5-3210M).
* Developer confirms a fix will be released in version 11.1.2.
* User updates to 11.1.2 and confirms the issue is resolved.

**Problems identified:**

* AVX2 not supported on certain older CPUs, causing incompatibility with the latest version of PiecesOS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Developer released version 11.1.2 with a fix for AVX2 incompatibility.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue resolved, user confirmed success with version 11.1.2.

**Additional notes:**

* User notified via Discord channel about the fix.

Overall, the conversation highlights effective communication between the developer and user, leading to a quick resolution of the issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:**

- Some users are having problems launching PiecesOS, with an error related to the 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension requiring AVX2 support, which is not available on some CPUs.

**Problems Identified:**

- The PiecesOS application was unable to boot up due to a hardware requirement issue.
- This problem was affecting multiple users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The Pieces team investigated the issue and determined it was related to a failing dependency of the AVX2 vector library.
- They worked around the clock to develop a fix and released a new version (11.1.2) of PiecesOS that addressed the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue has been resolved. Users experiencing this problem can update to PiecesOS version 11.1.2 and the application should launch without errors.

**Additional Details:**

- The initial response from the Pieces support bot provided helpful resources and suggested related issues.
- Mark, a Pieces team member, reached out to the affected user for additional information and offered to schedule a call for further troubleshooting.
- The user provided logs indicating the error and screenshots of their machine's tech specs.
- Another Pieces team member, tsavo, informed the user about the ongoing development efforts to fix the issue.
- Once the fix was released, Mark notified the user and they confirmed that the problem was resolved after updating to the latest version.

* The Pieces support bot automatically triaged the issue and provided helpful resources.
* The user was asked to attach logs from their system for further diagnosis.
* The Pieces team acknowledged that there were known issues with hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.

**Problems Identified:**

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A patch release (11.1.2) was planned to fix the hardware requirement issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The patch release (11.1.2) was released.
* The user was asked to update to the new version and confirm if the issue was resolved.
* The issue was closed after no further responses were received.

**Overall, the Pieces team was prompt in acknowledging the issue, communicating with the user, and providing a fix.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Failure: Stuck on Core Dependencies
common_issues.description: Multiple users report PiecesOS failing to launch, stuck on "ensure core dependency" step. This occurs across macOS and Windows, particularly after updates. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest version, reinstalling the application, clearing the data directory, and ensuring compatibility with OneDrive.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and gets stuck on the `ensure core dependency` step in the desktop application.

**Key Points:**

* **Problem:** PiecesOS fails to boot up properly, remaining stuck on the `ensure core dependency` step.
* **Affected Users:** This issue has been reported by multiple users on both Windows and macOS platforms.
* **Key Contributing Factors:**
    * Data migration during the upgrade to version 11.1.0.
    * Conflicting software like OneDrive.
    * macOS compatibility issues.
* **Proposed Solutions:**
    * Update to the latest version (11.1.1 or 11.1.2)
    * Uninstall and reinstall the application.
    * Clean the data directory (c:/Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs).
    * Close and re-open the app (applies to macOS users specifically).
    * Remove the `com.pieces.os` folder from OneDrive.
    * Awaiting patch 3.3.8 for the desktop app.
* **Current Status:** The issue appears to be resolved for most users with the latest version and troubleshooting steps. 

**Outcome:** The issue has been resolved for most users with the provided solutions. However, the team is still working on a patch to prevent the issue from happening altogether in the future.

**Additional Notes:**

* There may be some unresolved issues for individual users, as seen in the conversation.
* The team is aware of the link issue in the app when using Firefox as the default browser on Windows.

**Overall:** This issue has been actively addressed by the PiecesOS team and appears to be mostly resolved with the provided solutions. The team is also working on further improvements to prevent future occurrences.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch due to database error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on Ubuntu and Windows, encountering a "DatabaseException" related to the 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension. This was linked to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1. The Pieces team released a patch (version 11.1.2) to address this, advising users to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohit0072 reported an issue with the Pieces app not booting up.
* The issue was related to three other open issues (#620, #624, and #625).

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was unresponsive and unusable.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Tsavo-at-pieces suggested a potential fix with a release scheduled for the next day (Feb 13, 2025).
* Mark-at-pieces recommended updating to the latest PiecesOS version (11.1.2).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was potentially resolved with the release on Feb 13, 2025.
* Mark-at-pieces closed the issue on Feb 17, 2025, but advised Rohit0072 to reopen it if the issue persists.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers app failing to connect to cloud services or utilize local LLMs. This might be due to firewall, network configuration, or stricter hardware requirements in recent versions. Solutions include checking network settings, providing logs for analysis, and updating to the latest patch releases.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with making requests to Pieces cloud services and using local models.
* Mark-at-pieces suspected a firewall or network configuration issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Difficulty connecting to Pieces cloud services.
* Problems utilizing local models.
* Possible firewall or network configuration blocking access.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested log files from specific folders.
* Rohanrathi99 uploaded the log files to Google Drive and requested access for Mark-at-pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Rohanrathi99 has provided access to the log files.
* Mark-at-pieces has not yet analyzed the logs or provided further updates.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered a real-time debugging session via calendar invite.
* Rohanrathi99 accepted the invitation.

**Next Steps:**

* Mark-at-pieces needs to analyze the log files and determine the cause of the problem.
* Mark-at-pieces should provide feedback and potential solutions to Rohanrathi99.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue: Unable to download local LLMs

**Key points raised:**

* User (@AmanSingh766) is experiencing an exception while trying to download local LLMs.
* The exception message is: `Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress`

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to download local LLMs, hindering their work.
* The cause of the exception is unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Support agent (@mark-at-pieces) requested support logs from the user.
* Suggested checking if the issue occurs consistently or only with specific LLMs.
* Stated that the issue should be resolved in version 11.1.2.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User hasn't responded to the latest comment, so the status is unclear.
* The agent requested user to reopen the issue if the problem persists.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces cloud services and local LLMs, as well as launching PiecesOS. This could be due to network configuration, firewall settings, or software bugs. Proposed solutions include checking internet connection, switching networks, verifying firewall settings, and examining log files. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and providing support to affected users.

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.

- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with making requests to Pieces cloud services and using local models.
* Mark-at-pieces suspected a firewall or network configuration issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Difficulty connecting to Pieces cloud services.
* Problems utilizing local models.
* Possible firewall or network configuration blocking access.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested log files from specific folders.
* Rohanrathi99 uploaded the log files to Google Drive and requested access for Mark-at-pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Rohanrathi99 has provided access to the log files.
* Mark-at-pieces has not yet analyzed the logs or provided further updates.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered a real-time debugging session via calendar invite.
* Rohanrathi99 accepted the invitation.

**Next Steps:**

* Mark-at-pieces needs to analyze the log files and determine the cause of the problem.
* Mark-at-pieces should provide feedback and potential solutions to Rohanrathi99.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Title:** PiecesOS Unable to Launch  

**Date:** February 20, 2025

**Key Points:**

* User reported that PiecesOS is unable to launch.
* Issue automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces Support team.
* User informed of related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS is unable to launch.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces Support team will investigate the issue and provide a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is open and being investigated. 

**Additional Information:**

* User is encouraged to reference existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel for additional information. 
* This issue appears to be related to other reported issues concerning PiecesOS launch problems.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch due to various reasons like AVX2 incompatibility, core dependency issues, and database errors. Focus on addressing these root causes to quickly reduce ticket volume.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** The AVX2 incompatibility issue caused significant disruption. Clearly communicate any hardware or software dependencies for new versions to prevent similar situations.

**Investigate and address Pieces for Developers connectivity issues:**  Multiple reports indicate problems connecting to cloud services and utilizing local LLMs. Identify the root cause (firewall, network configuration, bugs) and provide clear solutions or workarounds.

**Review and enhance upgrade processes:** Issues arising from updates, particularly the "ensure core dependency" problem, suggest potential improvements in the upgrade process. Thoroughly test updates and provide clear instructions to minimize user disruption.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces for Developers:** Given the specific connectivity and launch issues reported, a dedicated support channel could offer more targeted assistance and faster resolution times.

**Proactively monitor for emerging issues:**  Track ticket trends and user feedback to identify and address emerging issues before they escalate. Utilize monitoring tools to detect potential problems in real-time.

**Develop a comprehensive knowledge base:** Create detailed documentation and FAQs addressing common issues, troubleshooting steps, and hardware/software requirements. This empowers users to resolve problems independently and reduces support load.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive information when reporting issues, including logs, screenshots, and system details. This facilitates faster diagnosis and resolution by the support team.
